title: Rapid and accurate arsenic metabolic metagenomic analysis
text: Arsenic () kind toxic metal-like element widely distributed world. understand microbial community arsenic metabolism environment, developed curated arsenic functional gene database (AsgeneDB) covering five arsenic metabolic pathways (transport, respiratory, reduction, oxidative methylation processes), 59 arsenic biotransformation functional gene families 414773 representative sequences. , protein sequences gene families recruited multiple public databases UniProt, NCBI RefSeq, KEGG, COG, eggNOG, arCOG KOG. AsgeneDB covers 46 phyla 1653 genera bacterial, archaea fungi. can quickly analyze arsenic metabolism transformation function microbial communities integrating multiple lineal homology databases high specificity, comprehensiveness, representativeness accuracy. AsgeneDB associated R Package greatly promote study arsenic metabolism microbial communities various environments.

title: Rapid and accurate arsenic metabolic metagenomic analysis
text: AsgeneDB.fa: Fasta format representative sequences obtained clustering curated sequences 100% sequence identity. file can used “BLAST” searching arsenic genes shotgun metagenomes. asgene.map: mapping file maps sequence IDs gene names, sequences belonging arsenic gene families included. file used generate arsenic gene profiles BLAST-like results database. id_gene_tax_pathway_total.csv: Species table sequences AsgeneDB. Columns included: Gene name (colnames:gene) Corresponding arsenic metabolic pathway (colnames:pathway) Taxid (colnames:taxid) Protein ID (colnames:protein_id) Kindom classification species (colnames:kindom) Phylum classification species (colnames:phylum) Class classification species (colnames:class) Order classification species (colnames:order) Family classification species (colnames:family) Genus classification species (colnames:genus) Species classification species (colnames:species) length.txt: file contains length amino acid sequences AsgeneDB standardizing arsenic gene abundance statistics.

title: Rapid and accurate arsenic metabolic metagenomic analysis
text: Description: provide Asgene Package metagenomic alignment (nucleic acid protein sequence), subsequent gene family abundance statistics sample abundance standardization. database files user needs built Asgene. Therefore, users need choose database search tool according needs (e.g., USEARCH, BLAST DIAMOND) input three parameters (e.g., working path, search parameters tool filetype) automatically analyze statistics output statistical results. Users can select gene abundance statistics (Option: abundance) normalize read counts per kilobase per million reads (RPKM) eliminate differences sequencing depth reference sequence length samples. addition, user selects functional species statistics (Option: taxonomy), driveing species arsenic metabolism gene different classification levels sample can generated automatically.

text: analysis Choose target want analyze,abundance taxonomy; type = "character"; default = "abundance" workdir Specify directory sequence file location;type = "character"; default = "./" method Specify database searching tool plan use, currently diamond, usearch blast supported; type = "character"; default = "diamond" toolpath Specify directory searching tool location; type = "character"; default = "./" search_parameters Define metagenomic comparison parameters; type = "character"; default = "-e 1e-4 -p 28 --query-cover 80 --id 50" seqtype Specify sequence type, nucl prot; type = "character"; default = "nucl" filetype Specify extensions sequence files, e.g., fastq, fastq.gz, fasta,fasta.gz, fq, fq.gz, fa, fa.gz; type = "character"; default = "fasta" PE Specifies whether metagenomic data PE files, noting PE files named "_R1 extension" "_R2 extension" (e.g., XINWEI_R1.fasta XINWEI_R2.fasta); type = "logical"; default = TRUE output Specify directory final result file; type = "character"; default = "./" test.data Example datasets provided input output help users better understand package; type = "logical"; default = FALSE
